item.title: Taylor Series for approximating ODEs
item.description: Taylor Series A taylor series is an infinite series that estimates any continuous function as a polynomial. Taylor Series defined at point x=a as : \[ \sum_{n = 0}^{\infty} = \frac{\mathbb F^{n}(a)}{n!}\cdot(x - a)^n \] luckily, this sytem can be further defined to: \[\sum_{n = 0}^{\infty} = \frac{ C(n)}{n!}\cdot(x - a)^n \] with C(n) being defined as the function tht gives the value of \(\mathbb F^{n}(a)\) for each n.Â this definition is beneficial as computationally, it is difficult to define the derivative function, unlike a simple numeric funtion.
